meanings.definition: The layer of the earth's atmosphere above the troposphere, extending to about 32 miles (50 km) above the earth's surface.
meanings.sent1: Planes fly in the stratosphere above the clouds.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the stratosphere to understand our atmosphere better.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous astronaut decided to take a nap in the stratosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high in the stratosphere of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The stratosphere is like a protective shield around our planet.

meanings.definition: A very high or the highest point or degree.
meanings.sent1: His ambition reached the stratosphere as he aimed for success.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in the stadium reached the stratosphere during the final match.
meanings.sent3: The price of the rare diamond went up to the stratosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness soared to the stratosphere when she received the award.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room was so high, it felt like it pierced the stratosphere.
